website_summaries.verdict: Comfortable gloves at a low price. Great belay gloves from a great brand.
pros: Great for belaying and rappelling, as well as scrambling
Solid grip for ropes and cables
A good choice for first time climbers but we suggest something more durable for serious belayers
cons: Some complaints that these are made cheaply – specifically seams coming loose

customer_reviews.title: Best glove at great price
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite glove to use for belaying when climbing and also for when I do Rappels. It fits the hand very while still being easy to remove and keep on me. I've had my previous pair for almost two years with constant use throughout the summers and there is still no wear on it. I got this for an extra pair because I love them so much. I am sure there are better gloves you can buy but I don't see the need of spending $50 on a pair of gloves when these work so well and the cost is at a great price for this level of quality.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: ... scramble in Zion as a beginner and it works great to protect my hands and it feels comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I just use it for the 1st time for climbing rock scramble in Zion as a beginner and it works great to protect my hands and it feels comfortable. I am a petite person and the fingers are a bit longer then my fingers and i ordered xs, which works out fine.
customer_reviews.author: W. L.

customer_reviews.title: MUCH TOO SMALL
customer_reviews.text: Didn't know how many stars to give this. The gloves are very good just might not be too rugged judging from the feel of the leather. The problem with this product is the sizing. It is terrible. I have medium sized hands and the extra large just fit, are very snug. What you get with cheap foreign labor and no quality control. Probably wouldn't recommend or buy another pair.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Bob

customer_reviews.title: Excellent grip! I was easily able to control my ...
customer_reviews.text: Got a pair of these to go up and down the cables on Half Dome in Yosemite. Excellent grip! I was easily able to control my speed on the way down with slight variations in grip pressure.
customer_reviews.author: MR G P JOHNSON

customer_reviews.title: Not bought for climbing
customer_reviews.text: They are comfortable, I didn't rate the durability because I haven't had them long enough or put enough time on them however they do seem very strong! As for the grip goes, I'm not a climber I only purchased this to help with cutting down a few trees over time. If climbing gloves are supposed to be very or even somewhat grippy then this is a horrible item to buy but if climbing gloves are supposed to have alot of slip to them then these are great gloves to buy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I got these gloves for a recent trip to hike to the summit of Mount Saint Helens. The guide recommended having gloves to protect your hands from the pumice as you scramble on the rocks. These were easy to wear, put on and remove. I used them for scrambling and while using my trekking poles. They held up good in the rough terrain and provided a bit of warmth as the temperatures fell.
customer_reviews.author: Velikova

customer_reviews.title: snug, consider sizing up if you have longer fingers
customer_reviews.text: I seem to always be between sizes, and usually wear a medium or large. since I need the dexterity to handle cables, knots, etc I opted for medium with these. Initial reaction: it's a very snug fit, but the fingertips are in the right location. I'm afraid if I went large they would fit better, but I'd have that extra slack in the fingertips which would not be ideal. There is also no padding on the top, otherwise they seem nice. I'll be putting them to use at Yosemite in a couple of months and maybe some indoor climbing before then. Will update the review after those experiences.
customer_reviews.author: Nick M.

customer_reviews.title: Great half dome gloves!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these specifically for the cables at half dome and they worked perfectly for them. Not super grippy where you'd have to peel your hand off each time, but good grip that when loosened allows for sliding along cable until next time you grip harder for a firm hold. Would definitely recommend these for half dome cables.
customer_reviews.author: D. Heimlich

customer_reviews.title: Whole size too big
customer_reviews.text: The finger length is about 0.5 to 1.0 inch too long. I ordered the extra small and it fits much better. I normally take a small or medium in gloves so I recommend downsizing at least one size.
customer_reviews.author: KJ

customer_reviews.title: Used on Half Dome Cables - worked amazingly!
customer_reviews.text: Used them on Half Dome - Didn't die! If you're doing half dome, couple recommendations: 1. Wear full fingered gloves - the cables are pretty brutal without them. 2. If you have a choice, wear leather interior up for more grip and these felt interior for the way down so you can easily slide down the cables. 3. These will be really great for belaying, but I wouldn't use them actually climbing. They're pretty thick.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Imboden

customer_reviews.title: Durability issue with cuff
customer_reviews.text: 2 pairs of fingerless support my arthritic hands but material unraveled at wrist band after first use. Tried full finger because of great support. Extra careful with velcro & wrist band.
customer_reviews.author: Paul P.

customer_reviews.title: Good durability for the price.
customer_reviews.text: 100% as described. My son and I climbed to OS route on the Grand Teton. We used them on the climb and rappel. They preformed well without excessive wear and tear. Buy with confidence.
customer_reviews.author: Marlon Bateman

customer_reviews.title: Durable and fit well
customer_reviews.text: I use these gloves for work climbing cell towers. They hold up way better than the typical grease monkey gloves I get at Home Depot. With every day use climbing towers, they can last up to a month or longer. I cant speak to using them in any other capacity.
customer_reviews.author: Geoff

customer_reviews.title: These worked great!
customer_reviews.text: What I was in Thailand crawling up and over rotting limestone, I was So glad I had picked these gloves for use on my trip. Well made, quality material. Nice and sturdy, without being too thick or bulky, without getting in the way. Good stuff.
customer_reviews.author: D. R. Kerr

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: I was very happy with these but am not sure if my grandson has used them yet
customer_reviews.author: Cathy Clouse

customer_reviews.title: Don't last
customer_reviews.text: After 4 scrambling hikes the index finger on the right hand is worn through and other fingers are showing signs of giving out. Otherwise the gloves fit well and feel good but if they don't last they are hardly worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: I have about small to average sized hands for a female and the size small fits fine. There's a little wiggle room in the fingertips. I've only used these gloves once so far, but they were definitely helpful during a hike that involved climbing/slight bouldering/moving branches out of the way. Worth getting for sure!
customer_reviews.author: EmTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Superb value and multipurpose.
customer_reviews.text: fantastic value. Cheap and grippy, I love the adjustable wrist strap. The ties for attaching the gloves to one another are useless and too hard to attach. Once you fight to get the small plastic piece through the tiny loop, good luck getting it out. Otherwise, great mutlipurpose gloves for climbing, yardwork, sailing, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Emma

customer_reviews.title: Feels Good and Durable
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these on a whim and because I needed it for my rappelling training. Didn't think it would hold up this long and not ripping up from handling the ropes. Quite surprised and definitely worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Tae C.

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality
customer_reviews.text: Thise gloves are a must have for those that belay. I should have bought thise before!! Bcs i am small i would buy a smaller size or kids size next time.
customer_reviews.author: M. Asmar

customer_reviews.title: Great for rope climbing
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for rope climbing training and they are holding up great! No more burnt up hands from the rope
customer_reviews.author: Maddie

customer_reviews.title: My hands thank you
customer_reviews.text: I picked up this pair for hiking up Colorado's 14ers to spare my hands when scrambling is required. They have done a great job protecting my palms and are flexible enough to still feel like an extension of my skin. I bring them with on almost every hike now.
customer_reviews.author: R.K. McLennan

customer_reviews.title: Good gloves for female lifter
customer_reviews.text: I like the comfortable fit of these gloves. I am using them for weight lifting. I did not like the fingerless kind so I bought these. I also don't like leather, which these are not. I have very small female hands. The small was a tiny bit big. The palms are padded but not heavily.
customer_reviews.author: LG Campos

customer_reviews.title: Came apart at finger stiching on first outing.
customer_reviews.text: Came apart at finger stitching on first outing on a 100 ft repel. Was disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: MR G A MCLEOD

customer_reviews.title: Not good for ropes climbing
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for ropes climbing and it not good at all for that. Those gloves haven't got green and I can't use them at all
customer_reviews.author: Niv S.

customer_reviews.title: They work great!
customer_reviews.text: Another high quality product from Black Diamond, as I've come to expect. These may be the cheapest gloves that BD offers, but they are just as high of quality. I have used these while mine exploring to protect my hands and while doing freeclimbing. They allow for a good amount of dexterity while also offering good protection and grip. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Janich

customer_reviews.title: but fit good and feel well enough
customer_reviews.text: Quite convenient for me. Do not think it will last long while intensive belaying, but fit good and feel well enough.
customer_reviews.author: Borys Shinkaretsky

customer_reviews.title: Rappel
customer_reviews.text: Used these going down Diana’s Throne in Southern Utah and they held up great! Only used them twice so far and have been down probably 10 rappels but so far holding up great! Did heat up a little bit when hand lining a 40 foot drop at a 80 degree slope. But love them so far!
customer_reviews.author: Smokey Joe

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: Don't have anything bad to say about these. They work perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Richardson

customer_reviews.title: I usually wear large gloves but the sizing these gloves ...
customer_reviews.text: I usually wear large gloves but the sizing these gloves said medium so I went along with it and they fit perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: A quality product well designed and put together.
customer_reviews.text: Love the gloves, great for rope access. I told all my friends about it.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Helbling

customer_reviews.title: good gloves for the price after a minor adjustment
customer_reviews.text: Fit my hands well, but the thumb tips were really tight for some reason. So I soaked them in water and stuck a screw handle into the thumb and let them dry, streched them out now they fit fine. They have a good grip. Im using them for gondola evacuation training at a ski resort, so mostly gripping metal and ropes and they work well for that. They are thin enough that I can tie knots without taking them off. Hope to get a couple of years out of them using them about 6 days per year. Really like the gromets and loops to hang them on a caribeaner so i dont lose them.
customer_reviews.author: C.

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Used these climbing and worked great. I originally bought a xs, but had to return for a s. They help up well in the rain and kept my hand protected on the rope.
customer_reviews.author: smilebright

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit on my small hands
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit on my small hands . Used for repelling class ! My hands felt shielded but karabiners kept snagging the tips . I probably would like the fingerless ones more !
customer_reviews.author: Ang

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: The stitching around the wrist straps tends to come loose. Otherwise, these are decent gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Mason

customer_reviews.title: I love it.
customer_reviews.text: Check the size chart in the Black Diamond web site, and fit as expected. Very nice gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Miguel Angel Gomez

customer_reviews.title: Best gloves for crossfit/ropes/bars
customer_reviews.text: Really good quality. I have worn them 3 to 5 times a week for months and no issues. Follow the size chart and you'll be fine! I've recommended to multiple people and they all love them.
customer_reviews.author: Chris in Chicago

customer_reviews.title: Very glad I did
customer_reviews.text: Haven't put these to too strenuous a test but I bought them to climb Half Dome @ Yosemite, and they were more than adequate. Very glad I did, too -- can't imagine having done it without them.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Essex

customer_reviews.title: Saved my hands
customer_reviews.text: I take my 6th graders on a week long science trip each year and end up belaying for hours while they rock climb. I bought these gloves to save my hands and they worked great!!!
customer_reviews.author: Matthew A Baur

customer_reviews.title: Gloves are great, I am hard on gloves the finger tips ...
customer_reviews.text: Gloves are great, I am hard on gloves the finger tips never last too long. But they do their job and protect the hands. You can get new gloves, you can't get new hands.
customer_reviews.author: Havah

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves, very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I use these gloves for belaying and rope handling while climbing, and they are great for protecting my hands from rope burn. They are comfortable, flexible, provide a great grip, and don't get too hot. I just used them on the Half Dome cables, and they worked very well.
customer_reviews.author: flyzapper

customer_reviews.title: Sick gloves.
customer_reviews.text: Sick. Right out of packaging fit well. With some wear should be snug as a glove. Quality made. Not too heavy, but will take a beating and protect hands.
customer_reviews.author: BMC

customer_reviews.title: Off label use
customer_reviews.text: I use these for work gloves ( Law Enforcement Special Operations). Thick enough for good protection and some vibration control, thin enough for dexterity. Good price
customer_reviews.author: Sean Ellis

customer_reviews.title: Yes yes yes and yes! I won't go canyoneering without them.
customer_reviews.text: I have taken these canyoneering in Zion several times. They have held up extremely well through dry sand and wet sand and rope. They are a life saver when repelling- I won't do a canyon without them.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Marshall

customer_reviews.title: Fits snug in the fingers, size up
customer_reviews.text: According to the size chart, I got an XS. Although the palm area fits good the fingers were very slender and snug making it uncomfortable when hiking and scrambling rocks. Not sure if they will stretch over time. I would recommend sizing up from the chart.
customer_reviews.author: Gloria B

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves
customer_reviews.text: I really like the feel of these. They do not rub and they handle rope very well. The top fabric is pretty breathable. I've been pretty satisfied with every Black Diamond purchase I've made so far. As good as Petzl at a lower price...
customer_reviews.author: Crimson

customer_reviews.title: Quality made Product - Would buy again
customer_reviews.text: Black Diamond makes quality gear as well as soft goods. These gloves are not too warm but do provide enough protection for holding the rope while belaying. I would definitely buy these again if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: More than just a good climbing glove.
customer_reviews.text: I find myself not just using this for climbs and hikes but now more for all purpose use around the house. Great product and value.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: For Climbing not rappelling
customer_reviews.text: These are a nice fit for climbing. They are not thick enough for rappelling though.
customer_reviews.author: sarah

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves for the money
customer_reviews.text: Great gloves for the money. I do a lot of urbex/ abandoned places exploring and need good gloves for broken glass, etc. These kept my hands pretty warm and dry and kept me from getting cut. Good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love the material
customer_reviews.text: Feel durable, soft but tough material. Got a large and feels like there’s room for a liner. Easy to put on and off. Climbed my house with them
customer_reviews.author: Shadi Bushra

customer_reviews.title: "fit like gloves". Like it
customer_reviews.text: "fit like gloves". Like it. love it!! I was glad they fit so well. Material was soft but very tough.
customer_reviews.author: Khoa

customer_reviews.title: Fits like a glove
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used them yet but already I feel the comfort factor surpassing my expectations. They certainly will function as I would like them to but I'm just waiting till the last thread on my old pair of gloves finally go.
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: So glad I got them
customer_reviews.text: I broke these in doing yard work and then I wore them during the Spartan beast at Killington. So glad I got them! Fit well and durable thus far.
customer_reviews.author: shalom jade eagan milani

customer_reviews.title: Lifesavers during halfdome hike
customer_reviews.text: I'm super glad i bought these before going. Amazing grip and protected my hands. Highly recommend for any kind of climbing adventure.
customer_reviews.author: butterfly_on_leash

customer_reviews.title: nice gloves, but a bit pricey
customer_reviews.text: nice gloves, but a bit pricey. they wear out a little less fast than cheaper gloves, not really making the extra cost justifiable. now I just buy cheap grippy palmed mechanics gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Motor Joe

customer_reviews.title: Best gray and black gloves I own
customer_reviews.text: Nice gloves, a tad small but I still have circulation in my fingers.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Hassman

customer_reviews.title: Fake
customer_reviews.text: These arrived w/o packaging and are super sketchy. Not the real deal - order elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: A GM

customer_reviews.title: Buy a size larger.
customer_reviews.text: I buy lots of gloves in XL- don't know why an XL in this brand is so small and uncomfortable. Very odd in today's market.
customer_reviews.author: Coolcar1

customer_reviews.title: I ordered a large one and it fit like a glove (as it should)
customer_reviews.text: Just measure your hand for accurate fit. I ordered a large one and it fit like a glove (as it should). Heh
customer_reviews.author: Ein

customer_reviews.title: Great Belay Gloves
customer_reviews.text: Perfect gloves to stop your hands getting rope burn or getting skin pinched by belay device
customer_reviews.author: C. Hedrick

customer_reviews.title: Work great!!
customer_reviews.text: These worked great recently for our rappelling trip in Capitol Reef National Park. They kept our hands from burning. They did run just a little bit bigger than expected.
customer_reviews.author: Logan Bentley

customer_reviews.title: Nice gloves. Wish I had bought a size bigger
customer_reviews.text: Nice gloves. Wish I had bought a size bigger. I'm 6'4" and bought a Large, should have gone with XL.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fit my tiny girlfriends hands perfect. Haven't used them belaying yet
customer_reviews.text: Fit my tiny girlfriends hands perfect. Haven't used them belaying yet, but seem perfect for the gym,maybe a little thin for all-day trad climbs but so far were pleased
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I(female) have very small hands. The size small fits perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves, perfect for rock climbing
customer_reviews.text: Great gloves, perfect for rock climbing. Well made. Fit is a little small, so size up, especially if you have long fingers.
customer_reviews.author: S. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Runs very small
customer_reviews.text: It runs so small that it is restrictive. For a size large the cuff was a full 0.5 inches short of my wrist Well built but order a size up.
customer_reviews.author: R. Opler

customer_reviews.title: Great work gloves.
customer_reviews.text: Great work gloves! They've lasted way longer than gloves designed specifically for construction.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Recommended for Short-Term Use
customer_reviews.text: The X-Small is a bit snug compared to Petzl brand of the same size, though the Petzls are stretchier, which could account for this. They aren't as sturdy as the Petzl brand either, but will work perfectly in most climbing applications if you aren't using them everyday. I use mine daily to ascend ziplines and things of that nature, and they've held up pretty well after a few months of use- just a few small holes in the palms. They're also about half the price of the Petzl gloves, so you get what you pay for with these, I think. I still keep them as a back-up to my Petzl Cordex, and lend them out for short-term use.
customer_reviews.author: Amber G

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love 'em, but the full leather ones are better for climbing and rappelling.
customer_reviews.author: CALVIN

customer_reviews.title: Great value.
customer_reviews.text: Great gloves nice snug fit side to side, yet the some fingers are slightly long. Also they don't look like the picture, I thought I ordered black and got ones with grey fronts. No matter though still look great. If you are looking for a comfortable set of gloves for ropes courses or climbing these are great, just don't expect them to be grippy.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Palacios-Baughman

customer_reviews.title: Good for my younger brother
customer_reviews.text: These were for my younger brother while we hiked out west USA. They worked great for him.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: They worked great for a climbing / repelling class I took.
customer_reviews.author: D. Brantly

customer_reviews.title: Nice gloves.
customer_reviews.text: Good quality. We use them for rapelling. Comfortable. Good dexterity while wearing them.
customer_reviews.author: Duncan

customer_reviews.title: Great value, durable
customer_reviews.text: Wore these hiking up a mountain with lots of boulders. They worked perfect.
customer_reviews.author: meryl

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great summer hiking gloves. I use them for hiking and climbing over rocks. Good grip
customer_reviews.author: D. Armstrong

customer_reviews.title: Worked but arrived damaged
customer_reviews.text: Small fit well and these worked well for climbing half dome. But only 2 stars because these gloves came with a hole on the pinky side the left hand glove.
customer_reviews.author: KND

customer_reviews.title: Great climbing gloves
customer_reviews.text: I needed some climbing gloves to do some tree trimming around my property and I didn't want just garden gloves because I felt they wouldn't help when I was climbing up the trees. These gloves were very helpful in getting a good grip when climbing the tree and when using my chainsaw.
customer_reviews.author: Wings2004

customer_reviews.title: hands stayed cool, protected very well
customer_reviews.text: Used them while crawling and climbing through caves. Fit perfectly, hands stayed cool, protected very well.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: good gloves
customer_reviews.text: I bought them to wear and use a camera at the same time. Setting your camera manually requires touches and turns ,the gloves worked great.
customer_reviews.author: RLS

customer_reviews.title: Good fit, not too stuffy/ hot
customer_reviews.text: I used these gloves to climb up the Half Dome cables in July. They worked really well. Good fit, not too stuffy/ hot. I would recommend these gloves especially for the pricing.
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: Useful for hiking rock scrambles
customer_reviews.text: Great gloves. I have used it while hiking, useful for rock scrambling.
customer_reviews.author: ddy

customer_reviews.title: Recommended!
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are excellent for Via Ferrata. They provide excellent grip and keep your hands warm and insulated from the cold metal. They do take a while to dry when wet. Other than that they work well!
customer_reviews.author: A man who buys things sometimes

customer_reviews.title: but I am very satisfied with the size
customer_reviews.text: I bought the gloves in a Large, and they fit very snug. My finger tips come to the end of the glove, with no left over material to get in the way. I was leery of buying gloves online, as to not trying them on first, but I am very satisfied with the size.
customer_reviews.author: Lochlan Reed

customer_reviews.title: Well worth it
customer_reviews.text: Fit very well and plenty of padding for belaying and long rappels. Haven't tried the via ferrata yet, but will soon.
customer_reviews.author: Jackalin

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice for canyoneering when you need rope and rock protection
customer_reviews.author: Maddie baker

customer_reviews.title: Good in all regards except durability
customer_reviews.text: Good in all regards except durability. I've been using them for about 6 months when belaying and the thumb crotch is about to wear through. So if that's what you're intending to use them for, I'd get a glove with more reinforcement instead.
customer_reviews.author: Jo Balme

customer_reviews.title: They worked fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: I used these for the Klettersteig in Murren, Switzerland. They worked fantastic!
customer_reviews.author: Tyler G.

customer_reviews.title: but they worked great and were super comfortable and tough
customer_reviews.text: Only used these for the cables at Half Dome so I can't speak to the durability over time, but they worked great and were super comfortable and tough.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn

customer_reviews.title: GREAT SOLID GLOVES
customer_reviews.text: Very good and strong pair of glove and great price can't go wrong this is one happy camper :-)
customer_reviews.author: BLACKHEARTT

customer_reviews.title: Am hopeful they are good for wearing while climbing
customer_reviews.text: Not ideal to wear while belaying because the rope slips in hand with the gloves on. Am hopeful they are good for wearing while climbing.
customer_reviews.author: melissa

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Too small for me but nice product. Ordered back in Large.
customer_reviews.author: Efrain Matos

customer_reviews.title: So far so good.
customer_reviews.text: I use these canyoneering. Was looking for synthetic gloves so they do not shrink after they get wet. So far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Rinzler

customer_reviews.title: Climbed the Half Dome with these
customer_reviews.text: Used these gloves to climb/hike the Half Dome. I used these on the cables to the top. They had good grip and fit well.
customer_reviews.author: Wesley Tian

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great gloves, I use them for rock scrambling and they are great. Size is perfect
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Strong and durable.
customer_reviews.text: Extremely durable gloves. Great fit. Have used them for some light climbing and hiking. Always good to have a pair.
customer_reviews.author: jonathan kruse

customer_reviews.title: Perfect belay gloves for sport climbing
customer_reviews.text: Perfect belay gloves for sport climbing. They provide good feel of the rope while keeping your hands clean and comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: H. T. Welser

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good climbing gloves (used by my son). He used them for a rappelling class.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Go up a size
customer_reviews.text: Fit was a bit smaller than described. Go to the next size, other than that its a great glove.
customer_reviews.author: M. IsaacsTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves
customer_reviews.text: Fit like a glove. Ha. I used it on on the Angels' Landing and Half Dome hikes and was glad I had these gloves. They gave me the traction and grip I needed. I'd buy these again if my current one somehow disappears.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Black Diamond Crag Climbing Gloves
product_meta.description:
A lightweight, breathable and durable cragging glove for belaying and via ferrate, the Black Diamond Crag protects your hands without compromising dexterity. Built with highly breathable stretch-mesh and tough synthetic leather, the Crag provides a firm grip and comfortable fit. Imported.




PRODUCT DETAILS
 * Is Discontinued By Manufacturer :No
 * Product Dimensions :13 x 6 x 3 inches; 3.95 Ounces
 * Item model number :BD801858
 * Department :Womens
 * Date First Available :December 3, 2012
 * Manufacturer :Black Diamond Equipment LTD
 * ASIN :B00AHEQ4IG

 * Amazon Best Sellers Rank: #49,868 in Sports & Outdoors (See Top 100 in Sports & Outdoors)  *  #39 inWomen's Outdoor Recreation Gloves, Mittens & Liners 
    *  #56 inMen's Cold Weather Gloves
